page.title: 01Landscape West of Corfe
page.content: This area is split into two very distinct halves by the ancient chalk ridgeway, leading to Corfe Castle in the East. To the south are the clay soils of the agricultural land around {Church Knowle.} Beyond the ridgeway to the North is marshy heathland, the centre of a still-thriving clay mining industry. Also crossing is the A351, the very busy road from Wareham that brings the tourists into Corfe Castle and provides the only main road into the seaside resort of Swanage to the south. This road can be a constant stream of traffic in the summer. Few cars leave the main road to take the twisting roads that pass East Creech and Church Knowle. The{Blue Pool, near Furzebrook, is, however, a considerable attraction.
